thinking.disposable_income: McKinley Park is a working-class neighborhood with median household income around $47,000, lower than Chicago's average. Many residents work in manufacturing and service industries, making them sensitive to transportation costs and taxes
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Limited discretionary spending capacity due to moderate income levels. Residents need to carefully balance transportation costs with other essential expenses. Annual retail spending estimated around $20,000 per household
thinking.accessibility: Well-served by public transit with Orange Line and multiple bus routes. Mixed transit/driving community with 72% of households owning cars. Close to major employment centers and retail corridors. Average commute involves both transit and driving options
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritize lower transit fares ($0.75) to help working-class residents while maintaining service quality. 2. Moderate tax rate (1%) balances revenue needs with household budgets. 3. Support modest driving fees ($0.50) to reduce congestion without overly burdening car-dependent households. 4. Focus on proposals that reduce transit travel times to under 55 minutes. 5. Avoid highest tax/fee combinations that would strain limited discretionary income
